body_html:
@nitheeshmuthuraj TOCO supports converting Keras models directly (command line documentation, Python API documentation). This is the recommended approach. However, this requires using the nightly build since support was added after 1.9.

TOCO still accepts frozen GraphDefs, so it is still possible to go from h5 -> pb -> tflite. This is the recommended approach for TensorFlow 1.9 and before.
body_text:
@nitheeshmuthuraj TOCO supports converting Keras models directly (command line documentation, Python API documentation). This is the recommended approach. However, this requires using the nightly build since support was added after 1.9.
TOCO still accepts frozen GraphDefs, so it is still possible to go from h5 -> pb -> tflite. This is the recommended approach for TensorFlow 1.9 and before.
body:
@nitheeshmuthuraj TOCO supports converting Keras models directly ([command line documentation](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/toco/g3doc/cmdline_examples.md#keras), [Python API documentation](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/lite/toco/g3doc/python_api.md#basic-keras-file)). This is the recommended approach. However, this requires using the nightly build since support was added after 1.9.

TOCO still accepts frozen GraphDefs, so it is still possible to go from h5 -> pb -> tflite. This is the recommended approach for TensorFlow 1.9 and before.
